author: CopperfieldRscr
content:
yesterday we shared our opinion/work on $CHGG (we are short the common)

https://t.co/ZYFr5N4lq2

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: today, we share a list of "mild-mannered" questions the sell-side should ask to at least create a perception of objectivity on $CHGG

author: CopperfieldRscr
content:
those 10 questions for $CHGG analyst day can be found here:

https://t.co/YP09tFHsWJ

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: We understand why the sell-side blindly supports $CHGG - they burn cash & require serial acqusitions to obfuscate deteriorating performance

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: Don't expect sell-side to ask challenging questions, but hope independet research analysts at least ask a few "non-softballs" for $CHGG

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: 1) Why doesn't $CHGG provide standard rev rec. table for “Adjusted PF Revs” which includes clean & consistent historical results for comps?

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: 2. Reconciling $CHGG Services with prior Digital Revenue metric (normalizing for eTextbooks and Ingram Commissions inclusion in both) (1/2)

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: 2. suggests $CHGG Services growth is just 16%. Can you detail how your 60% figure is calculated?

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: 3. Why does CEO repeatedly state that $CHGG generates "a lot of cash" when guidance for 2016 implies negative FCF?

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: 4. Excluding Ingram one-time catch up payments next year, what are the cash flow expectations for 2017? $CHGG

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: 5. How does $CHGG account for inventory transfers to IM?  When CHGG buys textbook on IM, how is transaction captured in the fin statements?

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: 5. What was the specific Imagine Easy revenue contribution $CHGG recognized in Q3’16?

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: 6. Excl. Imagine Easy subscribers & the reclassification of eTextbook customers, what was $CHGG organic, apples:apples subscriber count (1/2

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: 6. for $CHGG Services in Q3’16?  How does this compare to Q3’15, again on a clean apples-to-apples basis? (2/2)

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: 7. $CHGG failed to disclose any details regarding the “strategic equity” investment in Q3’16 – What was this investment?

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: 8. What is the gross margin for $CHGG Tutors? Why do your own publicly disclosed pricing metrics imply just a 33% gross margin vs your 60%+?

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: 9. Why does $CHGG 2017 adjusted EBITDA guidance include $6 million of “acquisition-related compensation costs?” (1/2)

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: 9. Are there additional acquisitions that $CHGG yet to disclose or have yet to occur that are included in the 2017 guidance? (2/2)
